ygData.messageBody:
Exactly the same. At least the pieces I made were. Except you do of course
not get the pluses on any statistics. Rather worthless as it is since in
the end any piece of reinforced you make will wind up costing you more than
it would have to just buy or hunt for snakeskin. Atfer around 23 failed
reinforced attempts I got 2 improvements in the skill with my 77
intelligence. Unless they start to allow the stacking of boning and studs
this skill is just too damned hard to work on.

Hm, I see from the others that I'm having spectacularly bad luck in getting
these HQ bear pelts. I mostly fought both common lands and the Karanas for
pelts and occasionally went to Everfrost. I'm starting to wonder if the
rumors about weapon type affecting the pelts dropped are true. I wield two
piercing weapons and almost never get anything other than a ruined pelt or
skin from animals. The exception being of course pumas who always seem to
have either med or HQ pelts for me.

A. Berg

At 13:16 24.6.1999 -0400, you wrote:
>From: "Schafer, Timothy L 1425" <Timothy.Schafer@...>
>
>Is reinforced leather better than snakeskin armor of the same piece, i.e. is
>snakeskin arms better than reinforced arms?
>
>If not, then snakeskin is the way to go. You get + vs poison, and it's
>fairly easy to get in Blackburrow, or Split paw, can't remember which one,
>but you could go there for about a week, and have close to a whole set. Our
>druid did it, with a friend to help, and they had it in 3 days.
>
>Wenaddar
